column2: Initialization error – occurs when the pump fails to initialize.
Invalid command – occurs when an unrecognized command is used.
Parameter out of range – occurs when parameter specifed for a command was not within the range of values acceptable for that command.
EEPROM failure – occurs when the EEPROM is faulty.
Syringe not initialized – occurs when the syringe fails to initialize.
Syringe overload – occurs when the syringe encounters excessive back pressure.
Valve overload – occurs when the valve drive encounters excessive back pressure.
Syringe move not allowed – when the valve is in the bypass or throughput position
column3: syringe move commands are not allowed.

column2: Pump is busy – occurs when the command buffer is full.
